website_summaries.verdict: A little pricey, but it can handle thicker sheets easily. Durable enough to allow for continuous use.
pros: Gives you the ability to carry sheets of thicknesses between 3/8 inch and 1-1/8 inches
Uses high-quality rubber pads inside the gripper plates that prevent damage to the materials being carried
Lightweight and durable, meaning you can use it over and over
cons: Only grips a thin edge of the sheet, so sheets could slip out if they're bouncing around

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works just as advertised. I own the contractor version (min 1/2" material) and have used it on plywood (1/2" and 3/4") and 5/8" drywall. I expected that it might damage the drywall, but it never did. I tried it on 10 foot, 1/2" drywall panels and was able to lift and maneuver them without a hitch.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Ratzlaff

customer_reviews.title: worked but might not last long
customer_reviews.text: Grip pad on one side started to slide off. It would move an eighth of an inch with each piece of 23/32 advantech decking that I moved. Had 60 sheets to carry into a basement by myself. It was going great up until the 40th sheet when I noticed the glue had released on the grip pad and it was sliding off. I was able to stick it back on every so often to get the job done but I dis not try to pick up a sheet without the pad in place. I was too worried about getting dirt in the glue and rendering it useless.
customer_reviews.author: Roberto

customer_reviews.title: Makes transporting full sheets of plywood much easier.
customer_reviews.text: This works great for my purposes. I am a hobbyist woodworker and have mostly been working on building shop projects. Cabinets and such. I like to use 3/4" maple plywood, and each sheet weighs 70lbs. While that isn't that much weight, anyone who's moved full sheets of heavy plywood knows it is difficult to manage. Using this gripper to move the sheets from my trailer into the shop to my storage rack was great. Would definitely recommend based upon my experience, which is all on flat ground. As for some other reviews/questions I've seen on here about it, I can't speak. I'm not climbing up ladders or going up/down stairs with it.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Steven Green

customer_reviews.title: but I recommend it for any tradesman who will use it often ...
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had this when I was younger framing houses. Really makes moving sheet goods much easier. Of course you still need the strength to lift sheets, but the Gorilla Gripper makes it less awkward. Really noticeable when wind is blowing and moving up ladder. Seems very well built and should last years. This can be used for plywood, cement board, and drywall. Basically anything big and awkward to lift that's less than 1 1/2in. It's a bit pricey, but I recommend it for any tradesman who will use it often to justify cost. As you know the job is a lot easier with the right tool and this is it for moving sheet goods.
customer_reviews.author: Soop

customer_reviews.title: Can't carry 5/8" OSB...don't buy
customer_reviews.text: This thing didn't work at all. I started carrying a 5/8" sheet of OSB, and it slipped off and smacked me in the face. Then after re-gripping the sheet and carrying it to the ladder, it slipped out again. Didn't attempt up the ladder for fear it would slip out a third time. Basically a complete waste of Ulysses S. Grant.
customer_reviews.author: Jared C Cochran

customer_reviews.title: Well Made And Useful
customer_reviews.text: This makes plywood moving so much easier. Moving heavy 3/4 Baltic Birch Plywood is unbearable without this thing. Seems like it should last me a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas Reinardy

customer_reviews.title: The lady on there commerical must be a weight lifter or something
customer_reviews.text: This product helps with plywood but takes some getting used to. It is not as easy as the lady in the commercial makes it look. Mostly this is due to the gorilla gripper making you carry the ply panel using your elbow bent at sholder level. This puts stress on your sholder and elbow. Probably not a problem for the occasional user, but if you swing a hammer and push a plane all day your elbow is probably already worn out and needs no futher abuse from a labor saving device. All in all, save $30 and get the stanley 93-301.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmie

customer_reviews.title: Needs more grip
customer_reviews.text: Only works well with 3/4" osb. Other materials will slide out including 3/4" plywood.
customer_reviews.author: Quercusalba

customer_reviews.title: Metal ONLY!  NO TO PLASTIC!
customer_reviews.text: I used and loved the PLASTIC version until it broke and almost took off several toes. The metal version appears to be suitably strong for its intended use. I use mine to move sheet goods from my pick up truck to my shop about 100' in back.
customer_reviews.author: Sleuth JohnB

customer_reviews.title: This falls into the category of "why didn't I think ...
customer_reviews.text: This falls into the category of "why didn't I think of this!". This is by far the easiest way for one person to handle an entire sheet of plywood. I'm not as young as I used to be and this has made moving full sheets of 3/4" plywood around the shop much easier. A must have tool if you frequently need to move full sheets of plywood or other sheet goods. I even take it to the store/lumber yard with me.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Lyons

customer_reviews.title: gorilla panel gripper
customer_reviews.text: love this tool. can carry about anything that is 7/8" or less thickness. easy to use, excellent gripping AND YOU DONT HAVE TO BEND OVER TO LIFT A SHEET. love this so much, i am going to order the door gripper.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Saves my elbows and time
customer_reviews.text: I work in a small cabinet shop where I have to haul material from one end of the shop to the table saw at the other end. Over the years I have injured both elbows carrying heavy sheets of melamine and plywood. This little device works beautifully! It's built very sturdy and allows one to lift with their whole body. It allows one to carry material in a more comfortable position as well. Yesterday I carried 5 sheets of 3/4 oak ply and 11 sheets of 5/8 melamine. No joint pain at all! The material is still heavy, but the Gorilla Gripper allows better body positioning for the hall the the back of the shop. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: pearl

customer_reviews.title: DECEIVINGLY SIMPLE
customer_reviews.text: Now, if this device could only make a 4X8 piece of 3/4 inch ply lighter, it would be great. Unfortunately it cannot. But it can do the next best thing. Instead of having to push your ply along the ground and hope you don't hit a crack or get stuck on something, this deceivingly simple , but well built device lifts the panel off the ground for easier maneuverability. The body position when lifting is also easier on the back and shoulders, then trying to jerk it around. It's well built, but I think a bit overpriced.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Berrenson

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Used the gripper to move plywood, very easy on the back.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Clever sheet goods handler
customer_reviews.text: This device is a quality made lifting device for hoisting and carrying heavy sheet goods such as plywood and chipboard. The no-mar surface grips the material and leaves no marks. The cam action grip is well made and grips the sheet well. I often hoist construction grade plywood and siding by myself and this device allows me to do it in a safer manner. Your body will thank you for using this product and avoiding the strain and pain that sometimes results when trying to lift heavy and akward products.
customer_reviews.author: Ponapeman

customer_reviews.title: great material handling product!
customer_reviews.text: It feels so robust, grip strongly to the material. Very helpful and no more muscle injury because of it's ergonomical design and function. But be careful, it is not intended to lift a finished panels. It can defect the finished surface by transfering rubber grip pattern to the finished surface. Use only for material handling only. Protect your muscle fron suddent injury! You should own one for your own safety!
customer_reviews.author: Adi Santosa Budiman

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Clever device to carry a 4'x8' panel, just have to balance it properly.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Sprankle

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I didn't really have any trouble with it slipping unless I was rushing and tried to readjust. I carried 12 sheets of 7/16 OSB down hill to my shop and had no issues. I would wear steel toes though just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Gorilla Grip
customer_reviews.text: Oh my gosh! This thing works as good as advertised. If you ever have the need to work alone and carry full sheets of plywood or siding, when a helping hand is unavailable, you can get it done with this. The weight of the item does not go away, but it sure makes it easy to balance and carry the load with one hand, or two. I bought it to give to my friend as a birthday gift, but since I am in the middle of a project and I need it, I only showed it to him and told him he will have to wait.
customer_reviews.author: Big Al

customer_reviews.title: Love this panel gripper
customer_reviews.text: Love this panel gripper! I had tendonitus in both elbows while trying to drywall my living room walls and ceiling using the old fashioned panel holder. Not good at all! Then I got this while doing the same job in my kitchen...what a difference! No more sore elbows! I was skeptical about the holding power but have not had a single sheet drop. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for carrying around sheets of plywood.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband on the request of my son. Hubby already has one but they needed another one for when my son helps him with handyman projects. The gripper is very sturdy and makes carrying the panel well worth the expense.
customer_reviews.author: Sadie Jane

customer_reviews.title: ... to heavy 4' x 8' sheet goods to move like plywood or drywall and have little or no help ...
customer_reviews.text: If you got a lot to heavy 4' x 8' sheet goods to move like plywood or drywall and have little or no help then this is the tool for you. It makes solo lifting panels easier and keeps you from injuring your back or shoulder carrying sheet goods the proper position instead of contorting your body in a uncomfortable way. You just clamp it on the middle edge of sheet and pick up and carry
customer_reviews.author: mebo

customer_reviews.title: Got 4x8 sheets?
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect solution for anyone of average stature who needs to move 4x8 sheets of drywall, plywood, MDF, etc. From one place to another without assistance. Your back will thank you and you'll get the job done more quickly and with less (much less IMHO) effort and frustration. Just used mine to offload 22 sheets of 1/2" drywall, move them inside and stack them in the middle of my work area and Gorilla Gripper made the job almost a snap.
customer_reviews.author: Bullwinkle

customer_reviews.title: Great way to carry sheets of plywood!
customer_reviews.text: I only have one hand to carry plywood because I use a crutch to walk. This makes carrying sheets of plywood very problematic for me. This item makes carrying a sheet of plywood or MDF a LOT easier when you are working by yourself! I have used several different carrying methods and products and this is by far the best! I can carry a sheet of 3/4" plywood by myself, now! Try this you will like it a LOT, too!
customer_reviews.author: AZHawg

customer_reviews.title: It works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This is from a 75 year old DIY'er. I must admit I am in pretty good shape for my age but know my limitations. Not risking serious back,shoulder and leg damage is just that. This thing is just amazing. .Just make sure you center the Gripper on the long side and maintain upward lift on the handle. Caution: this is not for everybody. You still have to carry the panel from point A to point B using arm/shoulder strength. If in doubt get help.
customer_reviews.author: johnp37

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: The product was used to lift 3/4 inch plywood and worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Dr J

customer_reviews.title: Good product. It is much easier to pick up ...
customer_reviews.text: Good product. It is much easier to pick up 4 x 8 panels with the Gripper. I probably should have purchased one years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Mance T.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: Handling sheet-materials in my wood-shop has always been a struggle, and the Gorilla-Gripper has been a GREAT assist. I've been aware of this handy tool for some-time, but only recently purchased it to deal with sheets of MDF for an assembly-table project. Moving those "heavy" (and fragile) panels of 1/2" MDF would have been a two-man job, but with the Gorilla-Gripper - "no problem"! (Why did I wait?)
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: One Man Show
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Gorrilla Gripper because I am often by myself in the workshop and need to move paneling. It woeks as advertised, but if you are moving MDF or hardboard, you have to be careful with it slipping off. On plywood it works great. It does require you to lift with you arm more than the ones that pull up the sheet from underneath. I find it best when moving around 3/4 or half sheets.
customer_reviews.author: nittany79

customer_reviews.title: Must have this to handle sheet goods solo
customer_reviews.text: Great product. If you handle sheet goods alone you must have this item. I've used it for plywood, drywall, and cement board. It makes a tough job much, much easier. Everyone who sees it wants it. Be sure to write your name on it before is disappears.The only limitation is the thickness of the sheet goods. Although rated for material as thin as 3/8" some 3/8" plywood is slightly thinner. Watch your toes.
customer_reviews.author: Virginian

customer_reviews.title: Back saver
customer_reviews.text: If you use plywood or other sheet materials this is a great investment
customer_reviews.author: Sean Rubino

customer_reviews.title: Picking up a 4x8 sheet is not a fun process for very long and this helps you hold ...
customer_reviews.text: If you are working solo, this is a huge help. Picking up a 4x8 sheet is not a fun process for very long and this helps you hold the panel in a more comfortable and repeatable position. You could move a pile of boards with this and not get too worn out, but after hauling 5-6 over your head and sideways, your body doesn't appreciate it anymore. At least mine doesn't...
customer_reviews.author: Kiel D.

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: Moving 3/4 inch hardwood plywood by yourself without damage was not possibile for me before this. I would let one edge drop and a corner would be dented. This grips the edge and it is as easy as moving around a 2X4. As I get older I like to find smart ways to work rather than macho ways. With this, I'll get another 10 to 15 years of woodworking out of this body!
customer_reviews.author: Curious John

customer_reviews.title: Good Tool For This Use
customer_reviews.text: I use this tool to handle high density MFB used for cabinet doors etc. Each sheet weighs over 100 pounds and the edges are very hard and sharp and the surfaces very smooth. This tool enable me to handle these sheets alone and without fear of damaging my extremities. It does not make the sheets any lighter you still have to be in good shape and pre-plan your moves to use this tool on sheets of this weight to be safe. Using this tool on these sheets is not for the faint of heart panty waists. L.O. Mitchell
customer_reviews.author: L. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: this is awesome makes picking up plywood and sheetrock much easier
customer_reviews.author: Tim Kinney

customer_reviews.title: Good product without a doubt.
customer_reviews.text: This is certainly a good tool to have in your van, as carrying sheets of what ever description is made easier with this product. I have several types of carriers, and this rates as the best of them. It allow easy transport of sheet to AND within a building, which is appreciated when space is tight. The one proviso is that you keep a constant pressure on it, and too much 'bouncy' movement when walking will allow it to drop the sheet being carried, but that fact being known, it is still a benefit to have and I certainly recommend you to buy it. D B Hood: NZ
customer_reviews.author: D. Hood

customer_reviews.title: Save yourself a lot of grief with this product.
customer_reviews.text: I've seen these advertised for years and finally pulled the pin. It takes the awkwardness out of one person handling sheet goods of any type. Drywall and plywood can break your back, this saves it. Thanks for a great idea.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This item makes carrying plywood, sheetrock etc much easier for us ageing folks. Wish I had one years ago.
customer_reviews.author: DABitfire

customer_reviews.title: Love These Grippers
customer_reviews.text: These grips are great for carrying dry wall, etc. especially if you have no help.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great invention
customer_reviews.text: Really good thing to have when moving large building material. I work with a volunteer group that builds wheelchair ramps for disabled people who cannot afford one. We use a lot of 4'X8' treated 3/4" plywood. It is very heavy and most of us are older and retired. It changes the whole physics of handling large heavy plywood.
customer_reviews.author: MS354

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: Being short makes it difficult to handle big sheets of anything. With this, we can easily handle a sheet of drywall alone and carried 3 full sheets of luan at once with no problem. Since it only grips in the center or wherever you put it, anything more than one sheet of drywall , etc... they tend to scissor. But works great to carry singles.
customer_reviews.author: Lyric Lover

customer_reviews.title: No
customer_reviews.text: Sure if you want to throw out your shoulder. The device works from the top instead of from the bottom. Makes no sense
customer_reviews.author: Cobra

customer_reviews.title: Have to find the center balance point when carrying heavy stuff like MDF.
customer_reviews.text: Grips really well! Have to find the center balance point when carrying heavy stuff like MDF.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Moving plywood is much easier
customer_reviews.text: When I decided to make my own kitchen cabinets, I knew I was in for a lot on work. But I forgot jus how heavy full sheets i plywood are, especially when you are cutting several dozen into parts. This tool makes moving them without a helper amazingly easy. It grips, too. Even with pre finished plywood.
customer_reviews.author: quiinc

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Husband loves it and wishes he had it when building the house.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Mobley

customer_reviews.title: Another mush have tool
customer_reviews.text: Got my money's worth moving 20 sheets of 4x8 3/4" ply, 20 more to go. Must maintain constant pressure, else will slip - the only problem.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: has really been useful. good
customer_reviews.text: got one of these for each of my brothers. has really been useful. good product
customer_reviews.author: HB

customer_reviews.title: Great for those DIY'ers that need to carry large, heavy sheets of material.
customer_reviews.text: I'm an avid DIY'er, and this tool worked great for me while building my garage cabinets back in 2010. I was handling very heavy 4ft x 8ft sheets of 5/8" thick MDF sheets which are not only heavy due to their density, but also large and awkward to carry comfortably on your own. This tool made it so much easier to carry these large sheets! High quality construction and very durable. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Ricky

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for a gift. What a great idea! Gives anyone the ability to one-handedly lift large sheets of drywall, plastic, wood...well...anything that would normally require 2 people. My brother-in-law loves it! My brother has one also and uses it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: GeoRich

customer_reviews.title: wow
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical and only ordered one to try thinking it would sit in the garage with other bad purchases... I cannot believe how much easier it made carrying 4x8 sheets by myself!! I'm getting another one so we can move drywall around without interrupting someone else's work asking for a hand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Strong & Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Great panel gripper to move around sheets of plywood, allowing leverage and balance to 3/4" sheets. One-handed operation allows the plywood to be steadied with the off-hand when it's breezy outside. Resetting the device to find the mid-point is easy.
customer_reviews.author: GaryAJUSA

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: This thing does what it says. It allows me to move full sheets of 3/4 plywood relatively easily (they are heavy and this ain't gonna change that!). BTW, works on 1/2 inch sheetrock too .. .no damage.
customer_reviews.author: jsa

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It works ok but you will eventually drop one so you can't trust it 100%.
customer_reviews.author: Helgromite

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I saw this item on the DIY show "Cool Tools" and I knew it would be useful to me to move sheets of plywood and sheetrock around by myself. I am not a contractor, but occasionally do my own work around the house. I used the product right out of the box and used it to move a 4X8 sheet of 3/4 inch plywood with ease. It easy to use, has a comfortable grip and holds without slip.
customer_reviews.author: eek

customer_reviews.title: It sure makes one man carrying plywood easier. Very ...
customer_reviews.text: It sure makes one man carrying plywood easier. Very Very well built, if I could use 2 at a time I would buy another. No more Plywood splinters.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Washburn

customer_reviews.title: Wish I'd bought one a long time ago
customer_reviews.text: I wish I'd bought this a few thousand sheets of plywood ago. A panel's not very heavy compared to a lot of other loads, it's just very unwieldy. This is a quickly applied handle that makes it easy to manage a large panel. A great, simple, durable tool. I'm going to order another one.
customer_reviews.author: Denis

customer_reviews.title: WHY didn't I buy this sooner....?!?!
customer_reviews.text: This makes moving sheet goods 100 times easier when you are by yourself. Yeah, 1/4" stuff isn't that heavy, but it's still awkward. This doesn't just make moving 3/4" stuff easier by helping you grip it, but also helps with the awkwardness tremendously.
customer_reviews.author: WilliamF

customer_reviews.title: Two have tried it!
customer_reviews.text: I have two older employees, both have tried it and do not like it. They prefer the type that fits under the lower edge.
customer_reviews.author: Sailor Hank

customer_reviews.title: Great tool.
customer_reviews.text: It's amazing how easy it is to pick up a piece of plywood with this thing! It's the only tool I know of that doesn't require you to lift the panel to put the tool under it. Just watching a guy drag a 4 X 8 sheet of plywood up a ladder sold me. Flat stacked or against the wall, it doesn't matter.
customer_reviews.author: ronarella

customer_reviews.title: great carrier
customer_reviews.text: I haven't tried it, but my husband does. It helps him to carry much heavier things he couldn't do by himself before. I would say it is a great buy
customer_reviews.author: Vicky57

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I looked at the handles that fit under a sheet of plywood, but the Gorilla gripper is sturdier and makes it easier to pull a sheet of plywood off a stack. Makes working with sheet stock less tedious for one person.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Zehner

customer_reviews.title: great tool
customer_reviews.text: just what a 70 year old man needs for helping to move sheet goods around
customer_reviews.author: Charles R.

customer_reviews.title: Will not  hold a sheet of 1/2 plywood
customer_reviews.text: Will not hold a sheet of 1/2 plywood. Drop it every time, works fine on any size larger. Had to tap spacer to the pad to get it to hold.
customer_reviews.author: R. G. Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Not as useful as I had anticipated
customer_reviews.text: This one wasnt quite as I thought it would be. I think it would be better for a taller individual as im a bit under 6 feet, i find it would be much more maneuverable if a typical 4' wide board were a bit higher off the floor. And becuase the physics of the device required its own weight to maintain grip, you cant well angle the board once lifted to another position, like to go up steps or such, without worrying if your going to lose the load. I often just dont use it.
customer_reviews.author: cyber kid

customer_reviews.title: Good handy tool
customer_reviews.text: Good handy tool. A bit pricey, but worth it for me. I have to move a lot of plywood and drywall by myself, and really saves my back!
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked well to lift stateside panels to second and third floor with rope and pulley.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Pennington

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this if you don't do this !
customer_reviews.text: This product is a very good and well built device however if the panels you want to carry have ANY dust on them and are'nt completly clean you will do what I did and give yourself a huge Black Eye!!! When it slips off !!! TO make this tool work like it should Run a couple of dry wall screws Through it so to penatrate the gripping surface This way it won't slip off and make you give yourself a black eye!! After the modifcation it works great! Kerry
customer_reviews.author: Cathy T. VanderWeyden

customer_reviews.title: Greatest thing since sliced bread
customer_reviews.text: I am disabled and cannot carry sheets of plywood any more. I now buy plywood in half sheets which my wife was bringing to the shop in the backyard. I seen this beauty on The Wood Whisperer and got it for my wife. She loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Kish

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe product
customer_reviews.text: Jaws do not clamp onto the sheets parallel and therefore only grip with a small portion of the area of the pads. Sheets of plywood slip out very easily because of this and you can get hurt very fast. I think this product is unsafe.
customer_reviews.author: rnewton

customer_reviews.title: Lift away
customer_reviews.text: A quality lifting tool. Well made in good material. Does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Larry B

customer_reviews.title: This is a great tool for moving dry wall panels by yourself
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool for moving dry wall panels by yourself. Just make sure toe gripper is is all the way down on the board.
customer_reviews.author: William J. Carson

customer_reviews.title: I hurt my shoulder and have one good arm---this delivers & it has a robust feel to ...
customer_reviews.text: I hurt my shoulder and have one good arm---this delivers & it has a robust feel to it (ie. it doesn't feel cheap, it feels sturdy)
customer_reviews.author: Jim & Ruby Albert

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: It's probably not worth what I paid for it. Like other reviews, materials can easily slip out from between its grip resulting in damaged material.. You might just be better off carrying it by hand.
customer_reviews.author: mflewis

customer_reviews.title: Now one person can carry a sheet of plywood!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this a LONG time ago, but it still comes in handy when one person is attempting to carry a full size sheet of plywood, drywall, etc. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Cori L.

customer_reviews.title: MUST have if you are ever moving large sheets of ...
customer_reviews.text: MUST have if you are ever moving large sheets of wood on your own. Works really well. SOLID construction.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Thanks to Gorilla Gripper for creating this wonder tool! You delighted me because I was able to buy a 'brand new tool' for a project that I feared I was completely equipped.
customer_reviews.author: David H. Baum

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic tool works exactly like it's supposed to can't get better than that
customer_reviews.author: bliberty

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: My Gripper arrived quickly, and works as advertised. The product is very good quality and made sturdy for extended use. When helpers are not available this is the way to go!
customer_reviews.author: Lou

customer_reviews.title: What a tool , saw it on TV and it works
customer_reviews.text: Used this on Habitat For Humanity project and I was a hero with this. I could carry very easily all the plywood, drywall and used it to take material on roofs much easier and safer, love it.
customer_reviews.author: VCH

customer_reviews.title: This makes caring any sheet goods so much easier! ...
customer_reviews.text: This makes caring any sheet goods so much easier! Grips the top of the sheet so you can lift with your whole body. I use this every time I need to carry plywood or sheet rock by my self.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: convenient to use. May not worth for single job ...
customer_reviews.text: convenient to use . May not worth for single job ,but well worth for every day or frequent use.
customer_reviews.author: Liliya  Gromysh

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't make heavy sheets any lighter, but makes it a lot more convenient to move plywood and drywall around.
customer_reviews.author: Nak

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: This thing rocks, there's no other way to say it. I can carry sheet rock all day with this and use a fraction of the energy it would take two people to do the same work. You can carry any material that's 3/8ths to a couple inches thick. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Fudd

customer_reviews.title: EZ to use and you can watch where you are going
customer_reviews.text: The thing works great on 8ft drywall. Today was the first time i used it.To me the best reason to use this tool is that you carry the sheet of material much lower so you can see where in the HELL you are going.No more hitting the tops of doorways.So Ez to use a monkey could do it.
customer_reviews.author: R.Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Back saver
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thing thinking it might be ok but I was very impressed. It works great
customer_reviews.author: Leasurewoodworking

customer_reviews.title: Must Have for the solo worker
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a re-model project requiring hauling of sheet goods up to my second floor. Pros: Easy to Use Seems very well build (Quality Materials) Hand grip is sturdy yet comfortable 4x8 sheets are cumbersome so this really help Cons: A bit pricey
customer_reviews.author: T. W. Grevstad

customer_reviews.title: awesome device
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing for packing plywood around. It is quick to set, and makes carrying a lot less of a strain.
customer_reviews.author: Earl

customer_reviews.title: Makes carrying 4x8 anything a snap
customer_reviews.text: Gorilla Grippers are a must for anything 4x8. Plywood, paneling, even drywall, moves with ease. I wondered if drywall would dent, it doesn't. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Martin

customer_reviews.title: its all a about easy
customer_reviews.text: my work shop is upsatirs, i use these to carry plywood sheets up stairs. this item grips great, and allows easy movement(with less splinters) if you handle large sheets of plywood these also may save your back
customer_reviews.author: artie2385

customer_reviews.title: The Gripper grips
customer_reviews.text: I got it. I used it. It worked great as long as I had enough strength to lift the object. It would hold for 2 - 4'x8'x1/2" sheets of sheetrock but I did not have enough strength in one arm to lift them. So I did one sheet at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Lynwood V. Prest

customer_reviews.title: Handy
customer_reviews.text: This has made carring plywood and drywall much easier for my husband. Works like expected. Takes some of the strain off of carring something so large and heavy. Recomend it all you guys (and ladies)out there.
customer_reviews.author: Laverne Arnot

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite tools
customer_reviews.text: Wish they were around 20 years ago. Best panel mover ever. Try it once and you're willing to pay whatever it costs. I'd heard rave reviews so I bought one. Not sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Horton

customer_reviews.title: Gorilla Gripper
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought this to use with picking up cement board while remodelling the bath. It worked great. It saved his shoulders and back.
customer_reviews.author: Kay L. Risch

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Makes solo sheathing and building alot easier, especially lifting plywood upto the roof.
customer_reviews.author: Teslin Mac

customer_reviews.title: Tricky but does the job
customer_reviews.text: The unit does basically what it advertises. I do find it tricky to get the right pieces setup and aligned so that the gripping takes hold. Nonetheless, if you're needing to move sheet around this is still a good thing to have.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Adams

customer_reviews.title: Very good buy!
customer_reviews.text: I have a bad back and this is truly a back saver. Good quality.
customer_reviews.author: M.E.M.

customer_reviews.title: Great for ultralight drywall
customer_reviews.text: I ordered one of these when I needed to haul approx. 40 4x8 sheets of 1/2" & 5/8" drywall into the house. It worked great for single sheets of 5/8" rock, and for double sheets of 1/2" ultralight rock. Since the sheets are taped together face to face, just needed to insert a cardboard shim between the tapered edges before gripping the panels, to avoid crushing the edges.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Edens

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for moving drywall & plywood
customer_reviews.text: Tool is designed to grip without damaging the surface of the sheet goods. Easy to use and comfortable for hours.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher M.

customer_reviews.title: lift it
customer_reviews.text: The thing does what it claims but you have to pay attention while using it or you'll lose your sheet. It's necessary to keep a steady hold because it will slip if you unload it for even a second.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Gripper Works
customer_reviews.text: This is a very handy tool. Just like the promotional video, you can carry a piece of 3/4 plywood with one hand. We used it to lift sheets up onto joists and it performed better than expected. Its sturdy and should last or years.
customer_reviews.author: C. Olson

product_meta.title: Gorilla Gripper 44010 Panel Carrier
product_meta.description:
FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Gorilla Gripper is a unique construction tool that allows one person to lift and carry heavy sheet goods (such as plywood, drywall, particleboard, melamine, tempered glass and granite) from the top, with much less strain and greatly reduced risk of injury to the back, neck, shoulders, arms & hands! The gripper works by clamping onto the top of the material, creating a sturdy temporary handle for the person who is carrying them. It allows the user to lift and move them with a straight back, eliminating the requirement of bending over to get under the bottom, thus avoiding the torqued back and the aches and pains that are far too familiar to construction workers and do-it-yourselfers. It's made of aircraft-grade aluminum, very rugged and virtually indestructible. It is continuously self-adjusting from 3/8-inch to 1-1/8-inch. Rubber gripping pads mounted on both plates protect the surfaces of the materials from being damaged or marred. There's just nothing like the Gorilla Gripper...it works!
feature_bullets: Makes it easy for one person to lift and carry sheet goods
Reduces strain on back, neck, shoulders & arms
Promotes personal safety in multiple ways

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars326 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
